The 'Bharatiya Janata Party' (;; translation: Indian People's Party; abbreviated
'BJP') is the smaller of the two major parties in the Indian political system,
the other being the Indian National Congress. Established in 1980, it is India's
second largest political party in terms of representation in the parliament and
in the various state assemblies.

The Bharatiya Janata Party designates its official ideology and central
philosophy to be "integral humanism", based upon a 1965 book by Deendayal
Upadhyaya. The party is labelled as "Hindu
nationalist",
